text: Thomas, not totally happy with that solution, I put the code at my template level, so each “checkbox” will have that style. I’m also thinking I can target that individual form, not the form element type. Any chance you know that?
Sure you just need to search out the form id "hsForm_" then use it to target the element you want.
You can get it directly from the form also

Some real world issues I've ran into doing it using the "id". I was asked to build a custom form for landing pages that was different from our other form on our services pages. We do lots of campaigns so I have to add this to the CSS file for EVERY form so I have like 30. Instead of cleaning it up I'm building a new drag and drop template and I think my solution will be to add the code specific to the form in the MODULE then just target the form using the name of my template which is also the top class....example `class="case-studies-global-01"` then no matter what form is dropped in that section it will format the same.
